reporter-output.line: Enter the user's email address in the 'Email Address' text box.
Enter the user's password in the 'Password' text box.
Click the 'Media: thePlatform mpx settings' menu link.
Switch to frame titled 'Media: thePlatform mpx settings dialog'.
Check if the 'Connect to MPX' button is present. If not then MPX has not been previously enabled.
Get all the selected import account options and store to a list.
Enter the account name 'DB TV' in the account select text box.
Click the account option from the drop down list.
Click the 'Account' title to leave focus off of the selection.
Wait for account to switch to the newly selected account.
Click the 'Sync MPX Players Now' link.
Verify success message of 'players returned for account' is present.
Verify there are no errors present.
Get the text of the first search result set item.
Select the 'Published' from the 'MPX Status' select ddl.
Select the DB TV from the 'Source' select ddl.
Get the text of the first search result set item.
Click the first search title link in the search result set.
Click the 'Edit' in the work bench.
Switch to the active frame titled 'Edit mpx_video_7 Automationca1c21746c dialog'.
Select 'AutomationPlayer228a36685a' from the 'Video Player' drop down list.
Enter the account name 'DB TV' in the account select text box.
Click the account option from the drop down list.
Click the 'Account' title to leave focus off of the selection.
Wait for account to switch to the newly selected account.
Enter 'AutomationPlayer228a36685a' in the 'Player Search' text box.
Click the 'Search by Players Title' link.
Click the 'Player Title' label to give focus to the player item.
Switch to the active frame titled 'Status report dialog'.
Verify success message of 'Cron ran successfully.' is present.
Verify there are no errors present.
Switch to the active frame titled 'Content dialog'.
Verify that the disabled player text is present for player titled 'AutomationPlayer228a36685a'.

reporter-output.line: Enter the user's email address in the 'Email Address' text box.
Enter the user's password in the 'Password' text box.
Click the 'Media: thePlatform mpx settings' menu link.
Switch to frame titled 'Media: thePlatform mpx settings dialog'.
Check if the 'Connect to MPX' button is present. If not then MPX has not been previously enabled.
Get all the selected import account options and store to a list.
Enter the account name 'DB TV' in the account select text box.
Click the account option from the drop down list.
Click the 'Account' title to leave focus off of the selection.
Wait for account to switch to the newly selected account.
Click the 'Sync MPX Players Now' link.
Verify success message of 'players returned for account' is present.
Verify there are no errors present.
Get the text of the first search result set item.
Select the 'Published' from the 'MPX Status' select ddl.
Select the DB TV from the 'Source' select ddl.
Get the text of the first search result set item.
Click the first search title link in the search result set.
Click the 'Edit' in the work bench.
Switch to the active frame titled 'Edit mpx_video_7 Automationca1c21746c dialog'.
Select 'AutomationPlayer228a36685a' from the 'Video Player' drop down list.
Enter the account name 'DB TV' in the account select text box.
Click the account option from the drop down list.
Click the 'Account' title to leave focus off of the selection.
Wait for account to switch to the newly selected account.
Enter 'AutomationPlayer228a36685a' in the 'Player Search' text box.
Click the 'Search by Players Title' link.
Click the 'Player Title' label to give focus to the player item.
Switch to the active frame titled 'Status report dialog'.
Verify success message of 'Cron ran successfully.' is present.
Verify there are no errors present.
Switch to the active frame titled 'Content dialog'.
Verify that the disabled player text is present for player titled 'AutomationPlayer228a36685a'.
